abstracts.cdata!:
The First Manpower Development Project
            will help alleviate current and projected shortages of
            skilled and semi-skilled workers in the industrial and
            health sectors as well as improve training programs for
            public and private sector managers. The project includes:
            (i) constructing, equipping and furnishing four trade
            training centers, extensions to two existing trade training
            centers, a new occupational safety and health institute;
            (ii) equipping a management training institute; (iii)
            providing fellowships and expert-services for introducing
            new disciplines, developing curriculum, establishing
            training organization techniques as well as enhancing
            management training programs. The project will strengthen
            Jordan's manpower development system. It is expected to
            benefit about 2,000 trainees per year, mostly from urban and
            rural low-income groups, by enhancing their opportunity for
            employment. The project does not involve any special risks.
